intro: Burmannia latialata, commonly known as the red-flowered burmannia, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Burmanniaceae and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and striking red flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in lowland rainforests. Its flowers are short-lived but attract various pollinators such as flies and beetles. Due to its unique appearance and habitat requirements, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
